contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=December 2008}} '''José Maria Ferreira de Castro''' ([[Oliveira de Azeméis]], May 24, 1898 – [[Oporto]], June 29, 1974) was a [[Portugal|Portuguese]] writer and journalist. At age 12, he immigrated to [[Brazil]], where his work at a rubber plantation for the next four years would be the inspiration for his most famous book, ''A Selva'' (1930), which was adapted for a 2002 film of the same title (released in English as ''[[The Forest (2002 film)|The Forest]]''). He returned to Portugal in 1919, and started working as a journalist. He was a noted oppositionist to [[António de Oliveira Salazar]]. He was also famous for his travel literature, namely his book ''A Volta ao Mundo'', recounting his travels around the world in the outset of [[World War II]]. ==External links== *{{pt icon}} [http://www.ceferreiradecastro.org/ Centro de Estudos Ferreira de Castro] *{{pt icon}} [http://ferreiradecastro.blogspot.com / Ferreira de Castro] *{{en icon}} {{IMDb name|0207890}} {{Authority control|VIAF=12335285}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Castro, Ferreira de | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = May 24, 1898 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = June 29, 1974 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Castro, Ferreira de}} [[Category:1898 births]] [[Category:1974 deaths]] [[Category:People from Oliveira de Azeméis Municipality]] [[Category:Portuguese anti-fascists]] [[Category:Portuguese journalists]] [[Category:Portuguese writers]] {{Portugal-writer-stub}}
